projects.title: Business Assistance Facility II- World Bank and Ministry of Industry and Commerce, Lao PDR
projects.description: Project Management and Technical Advisor. The BAFII (2019-2021) aims to support individual firms in building their skills and experience, so as to become fully internationally competitive. The intention is not only that firms in Laos be able to export more, but also that those selling in the domestic market be able to compete more effectively against imports, particularly with the expected loss of protection within ASEAN over the coming two to three years. The key activities of the BAF include (i) direct consulting services, advising individual firms on business growth plans; (ii) matching grants to assist individual firms financially in purchasing specialized business development services in support of growth plans; and (iii) rigorous impact evaluation of services provided.

projects.title: Ex-post evaluation of the EPA between the EU and its Member States and the CARIFORUM Member States
projects.description: Senior Economist/Consultations Team Leader.  The objective of the study is to determine the extent to which the Economic Partnership Agreement (EPA) has been implemented, where the bottlenecks lie and the extent to which the EPA has contributed efficiently and effectively to reaching the objectives set out in the EPA. The study will therefore provide objective evidence and analysis of the implementation and impact of the EPA. The study seeks to provide a comprehensive evaluation of the progress thus-far, and allow the Parties to understand the key successes and challenges that need to be addressed. The results of the study will feed into an in-house ex-post evaluation of the Commission, as well as the second joint periodic review of the EPA in 2020.

projects.title: Mid-term Review of Bangladesh Investment Climate Fund (BICF) financed by DFID
projects.description:
Project Manager/Subject Matter Specialist. The World Bank Group (WBG) and the U.K. Department for International Development (DFID), have been implementing a long-term programmatic technical assistance project called the Bangladesh Investment Climate Fund (BICF). The overall objective of the mid-term review is to evaluate the till-date performance of BICF 2, the World Bank Group's largest single-country advisory facility. The team provided recommendations to ensure the accountability of the program towards donors and stakeholders, and captured  lessons learnt that will generate actionable recommendations.
The program was assessed according to the OECD/DAC criteria of relevance, efficiency, effectiveness, impact, and sustainability. The Evaluation also addressed gender equality and Value for Money (VFM).

projects.title: DFID Africa Enterprise Challenge Fund - EMU
projects.description: Senior Economist. Monitoring beneficiary impact and lessons learnt from AECF's support across Africa. The AECF supports businesses to innovate, create jobs, leverage investments and markets in an effort to create resilience and sustainable incomes in rural and marginalized communities in Africa. Launched in 2008, the AECF has mobilized over US $356 million to date, leveraging more than US $658 million in matching capital and supporting more than 16 million people in 2017 through jobs and increased household incomes. AECF has so far supported 268 companies in 26 countries in sub-Saharan Africa across 40 value chains in our focal sectors of agribusiness and renewable energy.
